item.description: Prolific Russian ransomware operator living in California enjoys rare leniency awaiting trial (Getty Images) Prolific Russian ransomware operator living in California enjoys rare leniency awaiting trial Ianis Aleksandrovich Antropenko allegedly committed ransomware attacks from 2018 to 2022. item.title: Who needs VC funding? How cybercriminals spread their ill-gotten gains to everyday business ventures
item.description: Who needs VC funding? How cybercriminals spread their ill-gotten gains to everyday business ventures Briefcase full of U.S. currency. (Getty Images) Who needs VC funding? How cybercriminals spread their ill-gotten gains to everyday business ventures The benefits of cybercrime aren't all flashy cars and watches. item.title: Critical infrastructure security tech needs to be as good as our smartphones, top NSC cyber official says
item.description: Critical infrastructure security tech needs to be as good as our smartphones, top NSC cyber official says Bulazel mentioned the energy sector in particular, given the potential for hackers to turn off the power in the United States. It’s a sector that relies in large measure on supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems to monitor and control industrial processes. item.title: Cloud-Native Security in 2025: Why Runtime Visibility Must Take Center Stage
item.description: The security landscape for cloud-native applications is undergoing a profound transformation. Containers, Kubernetes, and serverless technologies are now the default for modern enterprises, accelerating delivery but also expanding the attack surface in ways traditional security models can’t keep up with. As adoption grows, so does complexity. Security teams are asked to monitor sprawling hybrid

item.title: Podcast: Why Software Development Sucks And 7 Mental Models To Help Fix It
item.description:
Shane Hastie, Lead Editor for Culture & Methods, spoke to Thanos Diacakis about how teams often struggle with software delivery. He proposes a shift in mental models and a four-step framework to systematically improve software development by focusing on bottlenecks, balancing different types of work beyond just feature delivery, and investing 20-30% of effort in improving how the team works.

By Thanos Diacakis
